Operation 'DeleteScheduledSingleSend' has semantic quality issues: missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Current description lacks clarity about the return value and the resulting state of the Single Send after cancellation. The suggestion clarifies that the Single Send transitions to draft status, specifies the success response code, and better explains the distinction between canceling a schedule versus deleting the Single Send. This improves AI agent interpretability regarding operation effects and state changes.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to cancel a scheduled Single Send using a Single Send ID.**

Making a DELETE request to this endpoint will cancel the scheduled sending of a Single Send. The request will not delete the Single Send itself. Deleting a Single Send can be done by passing a DELETE request to `/marketing/singlesends/{id}`.
data.description_suggestion: Cancels the scheduled sending of a Single Send by its ID. This operation removes the send schedule but does not delete the Single Send itselfthe Single Send remains in draft status and can be rescheduled. Returns a 200 status on successful cancellation. To permanently delete a Single Send, use the DELETE /marketing/singlesends/{id} endpoint instead.
data.reasoning: Current description lacks clarity about the return value and the resulting state of the Single Send after cancellation. The suggestion clarifies that the Single Send transitions to draft status, specifies the success response code, and better explains the distinction between canceling a schedule versus deleting the Single Send. This improves AI agent interpretability regarding operation effects and state changes.

message: Operation 'ListCategory' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Original summary 'Get All Categories' is too generic and lacks domain context. The improved summary specifies 'Single Send categories' for clarity. Description now explicitly states the return limit (1,000 categories), explains the purpose of categories in the domain context, and clarifies authentication requirements. This helps AI agents understand the operation's scope and when to use it.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to retrieve all the categories associated with your Single Sends.**

This endpoint will return your latest 1,000 categories.
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves all categories associated with your Single Sends. Returns up to 1,000 categories in the response. Categories are used to organize and filter Single Sends for better campaign management. No authentication parameters are required beyond standard API key authentication.
data.reasoning: Original summary 'Get All Categories' is too generic and lacks domain context. The improved summary specifies 'Single Send categories' for clarity. Description now explicitly states the return limit (1,000 categories), explains the purpose of categories in the domain context, and clarifies authentication requirements. This helps AI agents understand the operation's scope and when to use it.

message: Operation 'SearchSingleSend' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Original summary 'Get Single Sends Search' is awkward and unclearit doesn't indicate the action being performed. The improved summary uses action-oriented language. Description now explicitly lists the searchable fields, clarifies that filters work in combination, and specifies the return value. This enables AI agents to better understand the operation's capabilities and construct appropriate search queries.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to search for Single Sends based on specified criteria.**

You can search for Single Sends by passing a combination of values using the `name`, `status`, and `categories` request body fields.

For example, if you want to search for all Single Sends that are "drafts" or "scheduled" and also associated with the category "shoes," your request body may look like the example below.

```javascript
{
  "status": [
    "draft",
    "scheduled"
  ],
  "categories": [
    "shoes"
  ],
}
```
data.description_suggestion: Searches for Single Sends based on specified criteria including name, status, and categories. Accepts a request body with optional filter fields: `name` (string), `status` (array of status values like 'draft', 'scheduled'), and `categories` (array of category names). Returns a list of Single Sends matching all specified criteria. Supports filtering by multiple statuses and categories simultaneously for flexible campaign discovery.
data.reasoning: Original summary 'Get Single Sends Search' is awkward and unclearit doesn't indicate the action being performed. The improved summary uses action-oriented language. Description now explicitly lists the searchable fields, clarifies that filters work in combination, and specifies the return value. This enables AI agents to better understand the operation's capabilities and construct appropriate search queries.

message: Operation 'DeleteSingleSends' has semantic quality issues: missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Missing clarity on input format (array structure) and output response. Added specific details about request body format, response code (204), and irreversibility for better AI agent understanding of what to expect and how to construct the request.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to delete multiple Single Sends using an array of Single Sends IDs.**

To first retrieve all your Single Sends' IDs, you can make a GET request to the `/marketing/singlensends` endpoint.

Please note that a DELETE request is permanent, and your Single Sends will not be recoverable after deletion.
data.description_suggestion:
**This endpoint allows you to delete multiple Single Sends using an array of Single Send IDs.**

Accepts an array of Single Send IDs in the request body and permanently deletes all specified Single Sends. This operation is irreversible - deleted Single Sends cannot be recovered. Returns a 204 No Content response on successful deletion. To retrieve Single Send IDs, use the GET /marketing/singlesends endpoint.
data.reasoning: Missing clarity on input format (array structure) and output response. Added specific details about request body format, response code (204), and irreversibility for better AI agent understanding of what to expect and how to construct the request.

message: Operation 'DeleteSingleSend' has semantic quality issues: missing_output_details, vague_description. Missing clarity on response code and output. Added specific response code (204) and clarified irreversibility for better AI agent understanding. Also corrected terminology consistency (single vs. one) and improved actionability by specifying expected response.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to delete one Single Send using a Single Send ID.**

To first retrieve all your Single Sends' IDs, you can make a GET request to the `/marketing/singlensends` endpoint.

Please note that a `DELETE` request is permanent, and your Single Send will not be recoverable after deletion.
data.description_suggestion:
**This endpoint allows you to delete a single Single Send using its Single Send ID.**

Permanently deletes the specified Single Send. This operation is irreversible - deleted Single Sends cannot be recovered. Returns a 204 No Content response on successful deletion. To retrieve Single Send IDs, use the GET /marketing/singlesends endpoint.
data.reasoning: Missing clarity on response code and output. Added specific response code (204) and clarified irreversibility for better AI agent understanding. Also corrected terminology consistency (single vs. one) and improved actionability by specifying expected response.
